intro: Vochysia pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific vochysia, is a tropical tree native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanthaceae and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. It thrives in humid, coastal environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
